result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrell Derrion Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrell Derrion Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Terrell Derrion Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date. Case is adjourned to 11-23-22 at 9:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Terrell Derrion Smith in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Terrell Derrion Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. 
Case is adjourned to 10-14-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim requests bail modification as to the no contact order. Objections from the state. Court DENIES request due to reasons put forth on the record.

Defendant Terrell Derrion Smith in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Additional statement made by L.P.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defendant Attorney Golden was recently appointed, and is requesting case be adjourned for an additional Preliminary Hearing.   Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to Br 10.  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf30661  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LJP. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Terrell Derrion Smith in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/22/22 @ 1p

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/22/2022@1pm  
Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
06/07/22.    22RM029067
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
